block.p: Rebecca Jane Charnas and Scott Wagner Grant were married yesterday by Rabbi Jane Rachel Litman at the chapel of the Interfaith Center at the Presidio in San Francisco.
The couple received law degrees from Yale, where they met.
Rebecca Jane Charnas and Scott Wagner Grant were married yesterday by Rabbi Jane Rachel Litman at the chapel of the Interfaith Center at the Presidio in San Francisco.
Rebecca Jane Charnas and Scott Wagner Grant were married yesterday by Rabbi Jane Rachel Litman at the chapel of the Interfaith Center at the Presidio in San Francisco.
The couple received law degrees from Yale, where they met.

Mrs. Grant, 29, is a clerk for Judge Guido Calabresi of the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit in New Haven. In August she is to become a clerk for Judge Arthur J. Gajarsa of the United States Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit in Washington. She graduated magna cum laude from Yale and received a master's in biology from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. She is a daughter of Ren√©e Harris Charnas and Andrew E. Charnas of San Francisco.

Mr. Grant, 28, is the Thomas Emerson Human Rights fellow at David Rosen & Associates, a New Haven law firm specializing in human rights issues and public interest law. The fellowship is awarded by the firm to recent law graduates with an interest in civil rights. In August he is to become a special litigation and forensics fellow at the Public Defender Service for the District of Columbia. He graduated from Swarthmore. He is the son of Cheryl Grant and Stephen Grant of Salem, S.C.
